BradleyTerryScalable
  • Reference
  • Articles

Converts a graph representation of wins into a square matrix.

graph_to_matrix is a data manipulation function that converts a graph representation of wins data into a square matrix.

graph_to_matrix(g)

Arguments

g

A directed igraph object. If g is unweighted, an edge from node \(i\) to \(j\) represents one win for player \(i\) over player \(j\) (and \(n\) edges from \(i\) to \(j\) represents \(n\) wins). If g is weighted, the weight on an edge from node \(i\) to \(j\) represents the number of times player \(i\) has beaten player \(j\).

Value

A \(K\) by \(K\) sparse Matrix, where \(K\) is the number of players. The \(i,j\)-th element of this matrix is the number of times player \(i\) beats player \(j\).

See also

btfit.

Examples

g <- igraph::make_graph(c(1,2, 1,2, 2,3, 3,4, 5,6), directed = TRUE)
graph_to_matrix(g)
#> 6 x 6 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"
#>                 
#> [1,] . 2 . . . .
#> [2,] . . 1 . . .
#> [3,] . . . 1 . .
#> [4,] . . . . . .
#> [5,] . . . . . 1
#> [6,] . . . . . .

g2 <- igraph::make_graph(c(1,2, 2,3, 3,4, 5,6), directed = TRUE)
igraph::E(g2)$weight <- 1:4
graph_to_matrix(g2)
#> 6 x 6 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"
#>                 
#> [1,] . 1 . . . .
#> [2,] . . 2 . . .
#> [3,] . . . 3 . .
#> [4,] . . . . . .
#> [5,] . . . . . 4
#> [6,] . . . . . .
